intro: Hieracium murorramondii, commonly known as the Murorramondi hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium murorramondii is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain habitats.
